SEARCH
Package controller.medication

Class DiagnosisManager

java.lang.Object
controller.medication.DiagnosisManager
public class DiagnosisManager extends Object
The DiagnosisManager class provides utility methods for handing Diagnosis such as retieving, updating and adding it.

  • Method Details

    • findDiagnosis

      public static Diagnosis findDiagnosis(String diagnosisID) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Finds a diagnosis by its ID. This method retrieves a diagnosis from the database using the provided diagnosis ID. If no diagnosis with the given ID exists, a ModelNotFoundException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      diagnosisID - The ID of the diagnosis to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The diagnosis object associated with the given ID.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if no diagnosis is found with the provided ID.

    • addDiagnosis

      public static void addDiagnosis(Diagnosis diagnosis) throws ModelAlreadyExistsException
      Adds a new diagnosis to the database. This method adds a new diagnosis to the database. If a diagnosis with the same ID already exists, a ModelAlreadyExistsException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      diagnosis - The diagnosis to be added.
      Throws:
      ModelAlreadyExistsException - if a diagnosis with the same ID already exists in the database.

    • updateDiagnsosis

      public static void updateDiagnsosis(Diagnosis diagnosis) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Updates an existing diagnosis in the database. This method updates the details of an existing diagnosis. If the diagnosis to be updated is not found in the database, a ModelNotFoundException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      diagnosis - The diagnosis with updated details.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - if the diagnosis to be updated does not exist in the database.

    • isRepositoryEmpty

      public static boolean isRepositoryEmpty()
      Checks if the diagnosis repository is empty. This method checks if the diagnosis repository (database) has any records. It returns true if the repository is empty, and false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the diagnosis repository is empty, false otherwise.

    • getAllDiagnosis

      public static List<Diagnosis> getAllDiagnosis()
      Retrieves all diagnoses from the database. This method fetches and returns a list of all diagnoses stored in the database.
      Returns:
      A list of all diagnoses.

    • getDiagnosisByPatientID

      public static List<Diagnosis> getDiagnosisByPatientID(String patientID)
      Retrieves a list of diagnoses associated with a specific patient ID. This method searches through all diagnoses and returns a list of diagnoses that are linked to the provided patient ID. If no diagnoses are found for the patient, it returns an empty list.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The ID of the patient whose diagnoses are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of diagnoses associated with the given patient ID, or an empty list if no diagnoses are found.

    • getDiagnosisByPatientIDAndDiagnosisDetails

      public static List<Diagnosis> getDiagnosisByPatientIDAndDiagnosisDetails(String patientID) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException

    • getDiagnosisByPatientIDAndDiagnosisID

      public static Diagnosis getDiagnosisByPatientIDAndDiagnosisID(String patientID, String diagnosisID)
      Retrieves a specific diagnosis for a patient based on the provided patient ID and diagnosis ID. This method searches through all diagnoses associated with a specific patient and returns the diagnosis that matches the provided diagnosis ID. If no matching diagnosis is found, it returns null.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The ID of the patient whose diagnosis is to be retrieved.
      diagnosisID - The ID of the diagnosis to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The diagnosis associated with the given patient ID and diagnosis ID, or null if no match is found.

    • createNewDiagnosis

      public static void createNewDiagnosis(String diagnosis, String patientID, String doctorID, String prescriptionID)
      Creates a new diagnosis entry and adds it to the diagnosis database. This method generates a new diagnosis ID, retrieves the current date for the diagnosis date, and creates a new Diagnosis object with the provided diagnosis details. The new diagnosis is then added to the database using the `addDiagnosis` method.
      Parameters:
      diagnosis - The diagnosis description or name.
      patientID - The ID of the patient for whom the diagnosis is being created.
      doctorID - The ID of the doctor making the diagnosis.
      prescriptionID - The ID of the prescription related to the diagnosis.

    • getDiagnosisOutcomeRecordList

      public static List<DiagnosisRecord> getDiagnosisOutcomeRecordList(List<Diagnosis> diagnoses, Doctor doctor) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Retrieves a list of diagnosis outcome records for the specified diagnoses and doctor. This method iterates over the list of diagnoses, retrieves the associated prescription details, and extracts the medication names. It then creates a `DiagnosisRecord` for each diagnosis, containing the diagnosis ID, disease description, doctor's name, medication names, and the diagnosis date. The list of diagnosis records is returned.
      Parameters:
      diagnoses - A list of `Diagnosis` objects to retrieve the outcome records for.
      doctor - The `Doctor` object who made the diagnoses and whose name will be included in the record.
      Returns:
      A list of `DiagnosisRecord` objects, each containing details about a diagnosis outcome.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If any related model (prescription, medication, etc.) cannot be found.

    • getAPatientDiagnosisRecord

      public static DiagnosisRecord getAPatientDiagnosisRecord(Diagnosis diagnosis, Doctor doctor) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Retrieves a single diagnosis record for a patient based on the provided diagnosis and doctor. This method retrieves the prescription associated with the given diagnosis, extracts the medication names, and creates a `DiagnosisRecord` containing the diagnosis ID, disease description, doctor's name, medication names, and the date of diagnosis. The created `DiagnosisRecord` object is then returned.
      Parameters:
      diagnosis - The `Diagnosis` object for which the record is being created.
      doctor - The `Doctor` object who made the diagnosis and whose name will be included in the record.
      Returns:
      A `DiagnosisRecord` object containing the diagnosis details, medication information, and doctor's name.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If the prescription or medication associated with the diagnosis cannot be found.

    • getDiagnosisByID

      public static Diagnosis getDiagnosisByID(Patient patient, String diagnosisID) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Retrieves a specific diagnosis for a patient by diagnosis ID. This method searches through a patient's list of diagnoses and returns the one that matches the provided diagnosis ID. If the diagnosis is not found, a `ModelNotFoundException` is thrown.
      Parameters:
      patient - The `Patient` object whose diagnoses are being searched.
      diagnosisID - The ID of the diagnosis to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The `Diagnosis` object matching the provided diagnosis ID, or `null` if not found.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException

    • updateDisease

      public static void updateDisease(String newDisease, String patientID, String diagnosisID) throws ModelNotFoundException
      Updates the disease information for a patient's diagnosis. This method allows for updating the disease associated with a specific diagnosis of a patient. It searches for the diagnosis by its ID, and if found, updates the disease information. After the update, the patient record is saved using the `UserManager.updateUser()` method.
      Parameters:
      newDisease - The new disease name to be set in the diagnosis.
      patientID - The ID of the patient whose diagnosis needs to be updated.
      diagnosisID - The ID of the diagnosis to be updated.
      Throws:
      ModelNotFoundException - If the patient or diagnosis cannot be found.
